result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:26 PM Defendant Matthew M Heyn in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Beth Raymond in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has applied for SPD, but no one is appointed yet.  Case rescheduled.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Lennon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew M Heyn in court, in custody. Defendant has Stan Woodard on a previous case.  Defendant to follow-up with SPD to have him added to this case.  Case rescheduled.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
for Status Conference on 8/8/2022 at 2:00pm along with letter from the courts, three copies of Bail/Bond, Electronic Filing Notice, and State Public Defender information sheet.
Status conference on August 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today. 
- Defendant shall not use or possess any credit cards, debit cards, checks, or other monetary instruments not lawfully in his/her own name. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

08:51 AM Defendant appeared.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. No statement by victim.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
